entry.def: Someone's findings are the information they get or the conclusions they come to as the result of an investigation or some research.

example.ex: One of the main findings of the survey was the confusion about the facilities already in place...
example.tran: 这项调查的一个主要发现就是对于哪些设备已经到位搞不清楚。

example.ex: We hope that manufacturers will take note of the findings and improve their products accordingly.
example.tran: 我们希望制造商能注意到这些结果，并对它们的产品作出相应的改进。

entry.def: The findings of a court are the decisions that it reaches after a trial or an investigation.

example.ex: The government hopes the court will announce its findings before the end of the month.
example.tran: 政府希望法庭能在月底前宣布其判决结果。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of determining the properties of something
2. the decision of a court on issues of fact or law

sentences.sentence: "the findings in the gastrointestinal tract indicate that he died several hours after dinner"

Sentence.sentence: These findings echo earlier research that suggests our perception of food can sometimes trick our body's response to the food itself.
the new findings do highlight the benefits of focusing on our food and avoiding TV and multitasking while eating
What is the finding of the Global Humanitarian Forum?
That makes finding a solution all the more difficult.
Abilene Christian settled on the devices after surveying students and finding that they did not like hauling around their laptops, but that most of them always carried a cell phone, Dr. Dickson said.
She drove a full hour before finding a parking space.

sentences.en: Such a finding as this exquisite antique is rare indeed.
sentences.cn: 像这样一件精美古物的发现确实少有。

sentences.en: The committee reported its findings after a thorough investigation.
sentences.cn: 委员会在彻底调查以后报告了调查结果。

sentences.en: The findings of the court will be published on Wednesday.
sentences.cn: 法院的判决将于星期三公布。
